page.title: 05HISTORIC BUILDINGS-STRANRAER
page.content: One of the most famous sights in Stranraer is the{North West Castle. It used to be the house of the famous arctic explorer{Rear Admiral Sir John {Ross,}and it was built in{1815.}His father Rev.Andrew Ross was minister of Inch, which is near Castle Kennedy. He joined the navy at the age of nine and after fifteen years was made lieutenant. However,it is an arctic explorer that he is best remembered. It was on his second voyage in search of the North-west passage that Ross found the Magnetic North Pole. The difference between Grid North and Magnetic North is 6 degrees on the Stranraer map in 1985. Stranraer has an{old castle}in the town centre which was latterly used as a prison. It is being restored at the present time. The{tolbooth}is still in use as a museum.
